title: miladbey
author: miladbey
content: Hi everybody, hope you doing well. it's a while that i have known crypto trading assistant platforms like 3commas, cryptohopper,... please share with me your trading experience with them and let me know if you have any other crypto trading assistantthanks

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: You have to explain your purpose on the thread first before members can contribute to what you are saying. Make your thread robust for discussions, you are only making this first post and asking for experience, it is not ideal I believe. Do a briefing of whatever experience you are asking for, you are a newbie and I don't think you will get such attention if you don't represent yourself very well.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: miladbey on August 12, 2023, 02:24:27 PM SnippedI will not recommend any platform to you to help you in trading, it's something you can sit down and learn to do it by yourself, this forum alone is enough for you to learn, always read posts on trading discussion board, you can read articles and other threads you like on this forum with more information on trading, i will also render one thread to you to read and learn https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5446799.msg61999785#msg61999785 being a beginner on how to trade, for how long will you keep on depending on the trading platforms to help you out when you can do all yourself

comments.author: tjtonmoy
comments.body: Do it on your own. That's the best thing you can do if you are looking for a long time trading journey. If you do not have enough knowledge and experience in trading, you need to learn that first. Knowing crypto and watching it does not make you a good trader. You need to use your knowledge of the market and try trading using that. That way you will gain experience. Most importantly, you need to learn other basic things that are highly required in order to start your trading journey. For example, emotion control. If you don't have that, you are more likely to drop out before you can begin. Using an assistant is helpful, that's for sure. But if you start with that without your own experience in the field, you are not going to become successful in life. When you are somewhat capable of doing your own trading and able to analyze the market, then you can get help from those assistants. use your own knowledge to get started and then when you feel like you are making a mistake or need some inspiration, you can get help from those services. As for me, I don't use any such thing as this anymore. So I have less experience with it. I can not recommend any or will not recommend any. Because I don't like them.

comments.author: Huppercase
comments.body: Quote from: miladbey on August 12, 2023, 02:24:27 PM Hi everybody, hope you doing well. it's a while that i have known crypto trading assistant platforms like 3commas, cryptohopper,... please share with me your trading experience with them and let me know if you have any other crypto trading assistantthanksLast year or 2021/2022 was full of drama and sad episode between exchanges and all this trading enhancers. There were leakage in the backend of Binance and 3commas that lead to many people to lose funds. Lots of people were complaining that their funds were missing which made Binance to stop offering API integration to this trading platforms. It was a like a partnership for Binance to drive more traders from other platforms to their trading exchanges but it doesn't worth it after that leakages. You can read about the API leak that happened last year that lead to loss of millions by 3commas...read moreI'm not trying to discourage you from using these platforms, I'm only preinforming you about the dangers of API while using other platforms because the result is not good anytime you leak your API to another platform. Instead of using this, I think Binance has improved on their trading chart view, make use of their exchange instead of another third party.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: If you're a trader with small capital and only use one or two exchanges, I don't think using tools like that is going to help you that much. It is also risky as mentioned above, not to mention there are other open-source bots if what you're looking for is a simple automation tool. Just remember that using a tool, which most of the time requires you to buy some packages will not magically help you increase your profits.

comments.body: Quote from: miladbey on August 12, 2023, 02:24:27 PM Hi everybody, hope you doing well. it's a while that i have known crypto trading assistant platforms like 3commas, cryptohopper,... please share with me your trading experience with them and let me know if you have any other crypto trading assistantthanksIt helps you program trading so that you do not need to spend the whole day in front of the screen, and since the cryptocurrency market works 24/7 and changes can occur in it at any time, you must use software that automates trading for you, but it does not mean free money.It is like a robot that is programmed to execute orders, without the orders being clear and the strategy is good, as these bots will not make free profit for you. it is an advanced step, learn trading first and then move on to automate trading.

comments.author: Gallar
comments.body: Quote from: miladbey on August 12, 2023, 02:24:27 PM~Snipplease share with me your trading experience with them and let me know if you have any other crypto trading assistantthanksAs long as I started trading on the crypto market, until now I have never used any trading assistant platforms. Because basically, I prefer to trade independently rather than entrust it to other people or to a trading service platform. Besides doing independent trading,I think it will be better for trading career in crypto. Because the ability and knowledge in the field of crypto trading will definitely increase. So basically I am also not going to suggest any trading assistant platform to you. But I would rather advise you to trade independently. Moreover, you are still a beginner in the field of crypto trading, so it's better for you to learn about trading in crypto first, rather than immediately looking for a trading assistant platform. So that in the future, you don't always rely on anyone (trading assistant platform) to trade crypto. Even though learning to trade crypto independently, it will definitely take quite a long time, but you need to know, the results will really satisfy you.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: miladbey on August 12, 2023, 02:24:27 PM Hi everybody, hope you doing well. it's a while that i have known crypto trading assistant platforms like 3commas, cryptohopper,... please share with me your trading experience with them and let me know if you have any other crypto trading assistantthanksI did not heard about these platforms before but I did check the 3commas and it provides some features like smart trades, where they will take both short and long trades at once. This means if BTC goes up you are taking a profit in the long but also losing money in the short too so not that help full. Plus they could make your trades automatic to some extent only. And could do proper DCA which you can also do or schedule at any exchange. The thing is many people do not want to connect their exchanges, or wallets to some platform that is ensuring money even.Because if that platform are hacked or goes bankrupt then what will happen to the details and data a customer had already given to these platforms? Although 3commas did not asked my anything personal yet instead of email but it did asked me to connect my wallet or exchange I think the only options I got was of exchanges well not so sure about it because did not gave it full glance. But still the problem remains the same of anounmity and risking funds to others.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: I can't give a complete review since I used one of the 2 platforms. I am quite familiar with 3 commas and I used it in the past, Generally i used it just as an average trader. I did go so much into setting up the bot, but it tested its grid trading bot. It wasn't bad, but I was satisfied with the small profits, so I just continued to use the app as a portfolio manager.I know about cryptohopper, I even signed up for it but never got to use the bot. One thing that is work pointing out is that 3 commas was involved in some sort of API key leakage which led to loss of funds. So be very careful.
